```java
    public static void splitString(String input, String delimiter, String[] output) {
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, delimiter);
        int count = 0;
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String token = st.nextToken();
            output[count] = token;
            count++;
        }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String input = "Fruit: they taste good";
        String[] output = new String[2];
        splitString(input, ":", output);
        TextView textView1 = new TextView(getApplicationContext());
        textView1.setText(output[0]);
        TextView textView2 = new TextView(getApplicationContext());
        textView2.setText(output[1]);
        setContentView(textView1);
        setContentView(textView2);
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The code above uses the StringTokenizer class to split the input string into tokens based on the delimiter. In this case, the delimiter is ":". The tokens are stored in an array called "output". The code then creates two TextViews and sets their text to the first and second elements of the output array, respectively. The setContentView() method is used to add the TextViews to the activity.
